body:
Inspired by @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26506#discussion_r1036149426). Based on #26506 - draft until that's merged and I have some Concept / Approach ACKs on this (even though it's a small change - and can also rebase if #26506 doesn't get merged). The last 3 commits are non-base:

- 1437b0059 test: add cases to JSON parsing
- b143564df refactor: reduce unnecessary complexity in ParseNonRFCJSONValue
- d53953f99 refactor: use string_view for values

-----

Main purpose of this PR is to minimize copying (potentially large) RPC named arguments when calling `.substr()` by using `std::string_view` instead of `std::string`. Furthermore, cleans up the code by removing unnecessary complexity in `ParseNonRFCJSONValue()` (done first to avoid refactoring required to concatenate `string` and `string_view`), updates some naming and adds a few test cases. Should not introduce any behaviour change.

## Questions
- Was there actually any merit to `ParseNonRFCJSONValue()` surrounding the value with brackets and then parsing it as an array? I don't see it, and the new approach doesn't fail any tests. Still a bit suspicious about it though.
title: [WIP] refactor: RPC: pass named argument as string_view
